title: Kern feature error woes
content:
Every time I try to build kerning classes, I get the following error with each class:

\<\<[WARNING] Start of new pair positioning subtable; some pairs may never be accessed: [A.smcp Aacute.smcp Abreve.smcp Acircumflex.smcp Adieresis.smcp Agrave.smcp Amacron.smcp Aogonek.smcp Aring.smcp Atilde.smcp] [Y.smcp Yacute Ycircumflex Ydieresis] [/Users/chrisL/Library/Application Support/FontLab/Studio 5/Features/fontlab.fea 1226]\>\>

What do I do now?

ChrisL
author: dezcom

comments.content:
\> What do I do now?

Don't kern :^)

Then I would have to throw away my KERN zipup from Veer :-)

ChrisL

<cite>What do I do now?</cite>

Teach typography. Give your students the fonts with no kerning pairs. Tell them that they can only use those fonts for headlines, and imperfect kerning will lead to a failing grade.

"Then I would have to throw away my KERN zipup from Veer :-)"

You'de break your kernXedge haha

Chase Langdon

I remember that thread, David. I thought I did follow the one-time-per class rule but I will check again.

ChrisL

Then I might be chasing rainbows :-)

ChrisL

Try looking at the small cap Y class. I think you want to change it from this

`Y.smcp Yacute Ycircumflex Ydieresis`

to this

`Y.smcp Yacute.smcp Ycircumflex.smcp Ydieresis.smcp`

;^)

Hahaha! Great.

(And if you kern a lot, also try the AFDKO Generate Kern Feature script.)

Thanks, everyone! It wasn't the Y class but I did find a few other misdeeds caused by my attempt to do search and replace functions on some of my other classes. The big screwup though was having OE and oe in 2 classes :-/

I am really getting sloppy-brained in recent months!

I wish There was a good tutorial on FL5 class kerning. Anyone know of one?

ChrisL

<cite>Anyone know of one?</cite>

Hello Mr Lozos! Meanwhile, all possible troubles have been dealt with on Typophile. What's needed is a summary ...  ;-)  
I have a little script which checks kern classes for possible overlaps of content, and will update [required since the AFDKO kern feature script now allows for exception classes] and post it tomorrow. Too tired to do it now.

Karsetn

I did!

You can download it [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20130815091232/http:/www.kltf.de/kltf_otproduction.htm), it is called "Check Kern Classes". If something is wrong with class definitions, it shows a report in the Output Panel.

If you use the AFDKO 2 "Kern Feature Generator" script, you only need to define tags for leftside, rightside and/or exception classes there. Please see the .txt file for details.

Karsten

Karsten,  
Glad you had a good night's rest and hopefully a good hot dinner as well! Thanks, I 'll check it out.

ChrisL
